title: How to Connect an Xbox 360 Account to a PC

steps.headline: Open the Start menu.
steps.description: To do so, press the ⊞ Win key, or click the Start icon in the bottom-left corner of the screen.

steps.headline: Type "groove" into the search bar.
steps.description: This will bring up a list of search results, one of which is Groove Music. On Windows 10, with the Start menu open, simply begin typing "groove" on the keyboard and a search will start automatically.

steps.headline: Click Groove Music.
steps.description: Doing so will open Groove Music, which is a music player to which your computer and Xbox 360 both synchronize. If you sign into Groove with your Xbox 360 account, you'll be able to view your Xbox 360 purchases. You will need a Groove subscription on your Xbox 360 to play music on it.

steps.headline: Click Sign In.
steps.description: You'll see this option in the lower-left side of the "Groove" window. If you're already signed into a different account, click your name here instead and then click Sign Out.

steps.headline: Click Microsoft Account.
steps.description: This will open a page on which you can enter your Xbox 360 account's email address and password.

steps.headline: Type in your email address and password.
steps.description: These must be the same credentials you use to sign into the Xbox 360 account you're trying to link.

steps.headline: Click Sign in.
steps.description: It's a blue button at the bottom of the page. As long as your password and email address are correct, you should now be able to play your Xbox 360's music on your computer (and vice versa).

steps.headline: Re-open the Start menu.
steps.description: Press ⊞ Win or click the icon in the bottom-left corner of the screen.

steps.headline: Type "movies & tv" into the search bar.
steps.description: Doing so will bring up the "Movies & TV" app as a result.

steps.headline: Click Movies & TV.
steps.description: This app is where all of your Microsoft account's purchased movies and TV shows appear.

steps.headline: Click the person-shaped icon.
steps.description: It's in the top-right corner of the screen. You'll see a drop-down menu appear. If you're already logged in on a different account, click your account email and then click Sign out before proceeding.

steps.headline: Click Microsoft Account.
steps.description: Like Groove, this will open a page for you to enter your Xbox 360 account's email address and password.

steps.headline: Type in your email address and password.
steps.description: These must be the same credentials you use to sign into the Xbox 360 account you're trying to link.

steps.headline: Click Sign in.
steps.description: Doing so will open your Xbox 360's video library; you'll be able to watch any purchased movies or TV show seasons here. This process goes both ways: signing into your Xbox 360 with your default Windows account information will allow you to access your Windows' media on your Xbox 360.

steps.headline: Make sure your Xbox 360 is on the same network as your computer.
steps.description:
To do so, you'll turn on your Xbox 360 and sign in, then do the following:
Press the guide button (the X) in the middle of the controller. Scroll over to the "Settings" page and select System Settings. Scroll down and select Network Settings. Look at the name of the Wi-Fi network on the card that's in the foreground. If it matches your computer, proceed; if not, select your Wi-Fi network from this menu and wait for it to connect.

steps.headline: Press the Xbox controller's guide button again.
steps.description: It's the X in the middle of the controller.

steps.headline: Scroll right to the "Media" tab and select Windows Media Center.
steps.description: You'll see the "Media" tab to the right of the main guide menu after opening it.

steps.headline: Press A, then select Continue.
steps.description: It's at the bottom of the page.

steps.headline: Press A and review your eight-digit code.
steps.description: You'll need to type this code into Windows Media Center on your computer to pair your Xbox 360 with your PC.

steps.headline: Open your computer's Start menu.
steps.description: To do so, press the ⊞ Win key on the computer's keyboard, or click the Windows icon in the bottom-left corner of the screen.

steps.headline: Click Windows Media Center.
steps.description: It's a green app with the Windows icon on it. If you don't see Windows Media Center in the Start menu, just type "windows media center" into the search bar at the bottom of the Start menu and click on the app when it appears.

steps.headline: Scroll down to "Tasks" and click Add Extender.
steps.description: "Tasks" is a tab on the left side of the Windows Media Center window; you'll see the Add Extender button directly below it.

steps.headline: Click Next.
steps.description: It's at the bottom of the Windows Media Center window.

steps.headline: Type in the eight-digit code.
steps.description: This is the code you got from your Xbox 360.

steps.headline: Click Next.
steps.description: Doing so will implement the code. If you correctly entered it and your console/computer are on the same network, the two are now connected.

steps.headline: Re-open Windows Media Center on your Xbox 360.
steps.description: To do so, simply press the guide button, scroll right to the "Media" tab, and press A while Windows Media Center is selected.

steps.headline: Wait for your Windows media to show up on your console.
steps.description: Depending on how vast your Windows Media Center library is, this process may take awhile. Once your media is available in your Xbox's Windows Media Center app, you'll be able to listen to music and watch movies on both of your devices.

text:
Windows 8 and 10 Open the Start menu. To do so, press the ⊞ Win key, or click the Start icon in the bottom-left corner of the screen. Type "groove" into the search bar. This will bring up a list of search results, one of which is Groove Music. On Windows 10, with the Start menu open, simply begin typing "groove" on the keyboard and a search will start automatically. Click Groove Music. Doing so will open Groove Music, which is a music player to which your computer and Xbox 360 both synchronize. If you sign into Groove with your Xbox 360 account, you'll be able to view your Xbox 360 purchases. You will need a Groove subscription on your Xbox 360 to play music on it. Click Sign In. You'll see this option in the lower-left side of the "Groove" window. If you're already signed into a different account, click your name here instead and then click Sign Out. Click Microsoft Account. This will open a page on which you can enter your Xbox 360 account's email address and password. Type in your email address and password. These must be the same credentials you use to sign into the Xbox 360 account you're trying to link. Click Sign in. It's a blue button at the bottom of the page. As long as your password and email address are correct, you should now be able to play your Xbox 360's music on your computer (and vice versa). Re-open the Start menu. Press ⊞ Win or click the icon in the bottom-left corner of the screen. Type "movies & tv" into the search bar. Doing so will bring up the "Movies & TV" app as a result. Click Movies & TV. This app is where all of your Microsoft account's purchased movies and TV shows appear. Click the person-shaped icon. It's in the top-right corner of the screen. You'll see a drop-down menu appear. If you're already logged in on a different account, click your account email and then click Sign out before proceeding. Click Microsoft Account. Like Groove, this will open a page for you to enter your Xbox 360 account's email address and password. Type in your email address and password. These must be the same credentials you use to sign into the Xbox 360 account you're trying to link. Click Sign in. Doing so will open your Xbox 360's video library; you'll be able to watch any purchased movies or TV show seasons here. This process goes both ways: signing into your Xbox 360 with your default Windows account information will allow you to access your Windows' media on your Xbox 360. Windows 7 and Vista Make sure your Xbox 360 is on the same network as your computer. To do so, you'll turn on your Xbox 360 and sign in, then do the following:
Press the guide button (the X) in the middle of the controller. Scroll over to the "Settings" page and select System Settings. Scroll down and select Network Settings. Look at the name of the Wi-Fi network on the card that's in the foreground. If it matches your computer, proceed; if not, select your Wi-Fi network from this menu and wait for it to connect. Press the Xbox controller's guide button again. It's the X in the middle of the controller. Scroll right to the "Media" tab and select Windows Media Center. You'll see the "Media" tab to the right of the main guide menu after opening it. Press A, then select Continue. It's at the bottom of the page. Press A and review your eight-digit code. You'll need to type this code into Windows Media Center on your computer to pair your Xbox 360 with your PC. Open your computer's Start menu. To do so, press the ⊞ Win key on the computer's keyboard, or click the Windows icon in the bottom-left corner of the screen. Click Windows Media Center. It's a green app with the Windows icon on it. If you don't see Windows Media Center in the Start menu, just type "windows media center" into the search bar at the bottom of the Start menu and click on the app when it appears. Scroll down to "Tasks" and click Add Extender. "Tasks" is a tab on the left side of the Windows Media Center window; you'll see the Add Extender button directly below it. Click Next. It's at the bottom of the Windows Media Center window. Type in the eight-digit code. This is the code you got from your Xbox 360. Click Next. Doing so will implement the code. If you correctly entered it and your console/computer are on the same network, the two are now connected. Re-open Windows Media Center on your Xbox 360. To do so, simply press the guide button, scroll right to the "Media" tab, and press A while Windows Media Center is selected. Wait for your Windows media to show up on your console. Depending on how vast your Windows Media Center library is, this process may take awhile. Once your media is available in your Xbox's Windows Media Center app, you'll be able to listen to music and watch movies on both of your devices.
